page.title: 10RECREATION AND SPORT
page.content: milland has a sports club with its own ground and pavilion where they play football, cricket and stoolball. the pavilion has a licensed bar. there is a public three acre recreation field adjoining the village hall, a corner with swings and slides for the children and two tennis courts controlled by the tennis club. badminton is played in the village hall. liphook golf club, in the north, has an 18 hole course and club house. the whangarei cricket club has a ground behind ripsley house. riding is popular over the whole area, with many bridle ways, and in the winter is hunted by mr. goschen's pack of hounds. considerable areas of woodland are rented or owned for shooting - mainly pheasant and duck.
